meanings.definition: The ability to be compressed or made more compact.
meanings.sent1: The compressibility of the sponge allowed it to easily fit into the small box.
meanings.sent2: The compressibility of the snow made it perfect for creating snowballs.
meanings.sent3: The compressibility of the marshmallow made it squishy and fun to play with.
meanings.sent4: The compressibility of the clay was like molding soft dough in art class.
meanings.sent5: The compressibility of the foam mattress made it incredibly comfortable to sleep on.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a substance can be compressed.
meanings.sent1: The compressibility of the rubber band allowed it to stretch and bounce back easily.
meanings.sent2: The compressibility of the air in the balloon determined how much it could be inflated.
meanings.sent3: The compressibility of the pillow made it perfect for pillow fights.
meanings.sent4: The compressibility of the spring was crucial for the functioning of the clock.
meanings.sent5: The compressibility of the packaging material protected the fragile items during shipping.
